page.title: 08Farming around Nailsea
page.content: Most of the land around Nailsea is given over to{pasture}for dairy cattle on small{dairy farms}who sell most of their milk to Horlicks Dairies who have a processing plant in Clevedon and a bottling and distribution depot on the Blackfriars Estate here in Nailsea. There is, however, one dairy farm in the West End district of Nailsea which still processes and bottles its own milk - Biggs Dairies of West End Farm. There has been much local concern in recent years over the spread of new housing development in Nailsea which threatens to take over much of the surrounding farmland. People are worried that, eventually, Nailsea and Backwell will merge into one big town if the land near the B.R.Station is used for houses.
